page.title: 05TREES IN BRAMHALL
page.content: Bramhall is especially nice in the spring when all the flowering Almond and Currant trees are in bloom. Householders have planted these trees in their front gardens to make them look pretty and the council have planted lots on the grass verges. There are some very old trees in Bramhall especially Horse Chestnut and Oak. These can be seen on the roadside from Stockport to Bramhall.In the summer Bramhall Lane and Bramhall Park Road are alomst like tunnels with trees arched above the road.Bramhall Park has some very old trees especially Beech,Oak,Lime and Yew. Other large areas of trees are in Carrwoods,Happy Valley and Bramhall Golf Club.Most of the ponds have trees around them.Our school pond has two very large Italian Poplars,but last year in a gale one blew down.
